keyPolicies.policyDescription: Promises a tax system where you get the first £13,000 tax-free. VAT will not be charged on basic utilities such as energy.
Asserts that after leaving the European Union, the UK can take back control of its borders and choose who comes to live, work, and settle in the UK.
Commits to spend an additional £3 billion on the NHS sourced from money currently sent to the European Union.

mentions.candidate: I date my association with UKIP right from its very early days and I am a strong believer in the United Kingdom's freedom and ability to govern itself…

issues.brexitEurope: After we liberate ourselves from European Union domination, the money saved will be spent here in the UK.
issues.economy: Promises a tax system where you get the first £13,000 tax-free. VAT will not be charged on basic utilities such as energy.
issues.health: Commits to spend an additional £3 billion on the NHS sourced from the money currently sent to the European Union.
issues.immigration: Control our borders – after leaving the EU we can take back control of our borders and choose who comes to live, work and settle in the UK.

leaflet.personalStatement: For 8 years served as councillor for West Ewell and Ruxley, where he lived for over 30 years and was responsible for housing and finance portfolios.

politicalExperience.role: Councillor for West Ewell and Ruxley
politicalExperience.achievements: Responsible for housing and finance portfolios

images.caption: Robert Leach's photo with UKIP logo
